snippet: ESPN’s move spurred a debate about whether anyone would be left watching in 3-D television soon, and whether anything would be available worth watching.
abstract: ESPN says it is turning off its three-year-old 3-D channel in decision that all but cements trend as expensive flop; 3-D was hailed as next big thing in television as logical successor to high definition, but viewers did not buy into hype; news about ESPN spurs debate about whether anyone will be left watching in 3-D.
lead_paragraph: ESPN’s move spurred a debate about whether anyone would be left watching in 3-D television soon, and whether anything would be available worth watching.

headline.main: Future of 3-D TV Murky as ESPN Ends Channel
headline.print_headline: Future of 3-D TV Bleak As ESPN Ends Channel
